description: Construction of a new two storey dwelling to the side of no.55 Alleyn Park including provision of one car parking space
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of five years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title/numbers 1138- 1, 6, 7 and 8  (received 04/11/2014).   Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building on site.  REASON:	In the interest of securing a high quality development and to ensure that the resulting appearance and construction of the development preserves the visual amenity of the area as a whole in accordance withsection 6, 7 and 8 of the National Planning Policy Framework, policies 3.5, 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan 2011, policies 1.1, 1.2, 4.1 of the Ealing's Development Strategy and policies ELV 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing's Development Management Plan Document (2013) | Details of boundary treatment, new planting and any other soft/hard landscaping works proposed shall be submitted to / approved by the local planning authority and these works shall be completed prior to the first ocucpation of he dwellinghouse hereby permitted. Any trees or shrubs which within the five years of planting die, are removed or become seriously damage or diseased  shall be replaced within the next planting season.  REASON:	In the interest of the visual amenity of the area and to assist providing a suitable setting for the dwelling and screeening from neighbouring prooperties, in pursuance to the objectives of section 6 and 7 of the National Planning Policy Framework, policies 7.1, 7.4 and 7.21 of the London plan 2011, policies 1.1, 1.2 and 4.1 of the Ealing's Development Strategy and policies ELV 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing's Development Management Plan Document (2013) | The off street car parking space shown on the approved plans shall be made available prior to first occupation of any part of the development, and this area shall be kept continuously available for car parking and shall not be used for any other purpose. 	 REASON:	To ensure that there is adequate provision for car parking within the site, in accordance with section 6 of the National Planning Policy Framework, policy 6.13 of the London Plan 2011, policies 1.1, 1.2 and  4.1 of the Ealing's Development Strategy (2012) and ELV 6.13 of the Ealing's Development Management Plan Document (2013) | Notwithstanding the provisions of Classes A, B, C, D E and F of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995 (or any subsequent order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modifications),  no enlargement, improvement or other alteration to the dwellinghouse hereby approved shall be carried out without the prior permission of the Local Planning Authority, obtained through the submission of a planning application.  REASON: To prevent the overdevelopment of the site to safeguard the living conditions of adjoining properties and visual appearance of the buildings and the area as a whole,  in accordance with policies 1.1, 1.2, (f) nad 4.1 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 and 7B of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), and with policies 3.5, 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2011). | Sustainable Drainage System  A surface drainage scheme shall be implemented for the car parking area hereby approved based on sustainable drainage principles prior to the first occupation of the dwelling hereby approved.  REASON: To ensure the drainage measures comply with sustainability requirements, and to prevent the increased risk of flooding in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of Ealing's Development Strategy 2026, policies 5.12, 5.13 and 5.14 of the London Plan 2011 and section 10 of the National Planning Policy Framework. | Notwithstanding any information submitted with this application, the residential unit hereby approved shall be constructed to achieve to a minimum Level 4 of the Code for Sustainable Homes (based on November 2010 Technical Guide/ Addendum 2014 for England Technical Guide). The associated reports/ assessment and certifications to demonstrate compliance shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval as follows:  "	After commencement of development. Within 3 months of the commencement of construction of the development (Interim Design Stage Assessment and related certification)   "	After completion of Development and prior to first occupation.  A Post-Construction Code for Sustainable Homes Review/Report.  "	6 months after the date of first occupation of the development Post-Construction Stage Certificates verified by the BRE, confirming level 4 has been achieved.  REASON:  To ensure a sustainable living environment is secured in accordance with policies 5.1, 5.2, 5.3 of the London Plan 2011; 1.1 and 1.2 of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012; and policy 5.2 of Ealing Development Management DPD (2013). | Details shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval before the development is commenced, for the insulation of the building envelope, with windows shut and other means of ventilation provided, which will achieve Ealing's internal criteria for sensitive rooms.  The details should also include the provision of alternative means of ventilation in accordance with Authority's criteria.  The works should be completed before occupation and permanently retained thereafter.  REASON:  To protect occupiers of the dwellinhouse  from aircraft  noise in accordance with policies 7.15 of the London Plan 2011 policy 1.1 (j) of the Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy 2026 and Supplementary Planning Guidance SPG 10: 'Noise and Vibration'.
